aroma.notes: Mostly just a sweet vapor — ripe banana, faint spiciness.

acidity.notes: Small plum note accompanied by a louder 'twangy' note.

sweetness.notes: Not entirely flat, but not as complex as it could be.

finish.notes: Strong, lingering, alkaline, bad breath feeling. Sucking my mouth, may be astringent. Throat is dry halfway through cup.

flavor: Definitely overextracted. First impression was that the coffee was diluted except for the 'twang' note (is that associated with astringency?). Cup is missing some complexity, finish is a very strong and long 'bad breath' feeling. Coffee tastes diluted and somewhat metallic as it cools. Not enjoyable at all.
notes: 7 second swirl bloom with 70g water. Did not let spoon touch sides of filter and let the final swirl knock off boulders instead — the filter was much cleaner!
actionItem: This could have been a fluke due to a bad filter or the fact that the coffee is getting old. Two thoughts come to mind: your swirl bloom was vigorous, and your initial pour was very gentle. You've already been doing vigorous swirls, so next time pour a bit harder for more agitation.
